articles.title: Cyclists clear snow from Comm. Ave. bike lanes after storm, call on city for accountability
articles.description:
After weeks of uncleared protected bike lanes, advocates say winter bike access is a matter of safety and equity.

The post Cyclists clear snow from Comm. Ave. bike lanes after storm, call on city for accountability appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Cyclists cleared snow from Comm. Ave. bike lanes after recent storms.
Advocates emphasize the need for consistent winter bike lane maintenance.
Uncleared lanes pose safety risks and hinder equitable access for cyclists.

articles.title: Suspect in Canada shooting is identified as an 18-year-old with history of police visits to her home
articles.description:
Police said Jesse Van Rootselaar was found dead from an apparent self-inflicted wound following the assault on a school in the small mountain community of Tumbler Ridge.

The post Suspect in Canada shooting is identified as an 18-year-old with history of police visits to her home appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Jesse Van Rootselaar, 18, was identified as the shooter in Tumbler Ridge, Canada.
Van Rootselaar had a history of police visits to her home prior to the incident.
Boston residents may be concerned about school safety and mental health resources.

articles.title: FBI combs desert terrain for clues in Nancy Guthrie’s disappearance
articles.description:
A woman who was jogging through one neighborhood where teams were searching, said an FBI agent told her they were looking for anything that might have been tossed from a car.

The post FBI combs desert terrain for clues in Nancy Guthrie’s disappearance appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: FBI searches desert terrain for clues in Nancy Guthrie's disappearance.
Agents are investigating items potentially discarded from vehicles in the area.
Local residents remain concerned about safety following the ongoing investigation.

articles.title: Bondi clashes with Democrats as she struggles to turn the page on Epstein files furor
articles.description:
“You sit here and you attack the president and I’m not going to have it," Bondi told lawmakers on the House Judiciary Committee. "I am not going to put up with it.”

The post Bondi clashes with Democrats as she struggles to turn the page on Epstein files furor appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Bondi confronts House Judiciary Committee over attacks on the president during Epstein files discussion.
Bondi's remarks highlight ongoing tensions within the GOP regarding the Epstein case.
Local residents may feel political fallout as national issues impact Boston's political landscape.

articles.title: 7 things to do this Valentine’s Day weekend
articles.description:
Boston Frostival, new Asian restaurants, and free ice skating: Here are some last-minute date ideas this weekend.

The post 7 things to do this Valentine’s Day weekend appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Attend Boston Frostival for winter festivities this Valentine’s Day weekend.
Explore new Asian restaurants opening in Boston, enhancing local dining options.
Enjoy free ice skating at local rinks, promoting community engagement and fun.
